titleStmt.title: S. H. Paul to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG14029

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Enrolled Militia Records 1864 - 1865 ; Adair, Allen, Boyle, Daviess, Garrard, Owen, Pendleton, and Shelby counties
msIdentifier.idno: Flat Box 7, Folder 862-64 Shelby County Electing Officers Shelby Co. State Guard 5th Enrolled Militia CPT Richard H. George's Co.

body.p: Your, Excelency, Gov Thos E Bramlette having moved out of the district of Company, D.. 2nd, Bat Enroled Militia your Excelency will pardon me for herewith praying to Be, Excused from the further performance of the duties of the office of Captain to which office i was Elected By the Uneion people of the District & Commishioned By your Excelency the governer of Kentucky i am your obedient Servant

S. H. Paul
Capt.
Co. D. (2d), Battalion
5th Regiment of Kentucky Militia
Shelbyville Ky.
April. 16. 1864
5 Regt Shelby
Paul S. H.

Tenders his resignation as captain Co "D.." 2nd Battalion. 5th Reg Enrolled Militia of Shelby Co Which is accepted to take effect from this date.
Head Quarters State Guard
Insp Genls office
Frankfort Ap. 19. 1864
Respectfully referred to Genl John Boyle, Adjt Genl of Ky. for cancelment

D W. Lindsey
Insp General
Cancel
Boyle
Recd A G. O. 19" Aprl 1864
